Posts.EditableText: I'm 31 years old, and I've been playing text games since I was about 12. I've always wondered if the popularity of "retro" games was dependent on nostalgia, so it's really nice to hear that even text adventures can find an audience with new players in a world so full of "MUST HAVE THE BEST GRAPHICS EVER!!!" styled games. I can't wait to see what kind of game you come up with!

Hi Triangle,

I'm only 20, so I guess you were born into the golden age of text-adventure-gaming!  I'm hoping for a renaissance of these types of game - I'm not a big computer/video game player usually - I love to read though and the concept of text adventure takes that one step further.  No game with amazing graphics can compare to someone's imagination!
